Package ohos.aafwk.ability

Class Ability

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.app.AbilityContext
      • ohos.aafwk.ability.Ability
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILifecycle, Context
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccessibleAbility, AceAbility, AVBrowserService, FractionAbility, HostService, InputMethodAbility, IntentAbility, OffHostService, WorkScheduler

    public class Ability
extends AbilityContext
implements ILifecycle
    An ability is an abstraction of functionalities that a HarmonyOS application can provide. Abilities of HarmonyOS applications are classified into two types: Feature Ability and Particle Ability. A Feature Ability represents an ability with a UI and is designed to interact with users. A Particle Ability represents an ability without a UI and is mainly used to provide support for FAs, for example, providing computing capabilities as a background service or providing data access capabilities as a data repository. The two types of abilities offer different templates for you to implement different functionalities. At present, HarmonyOS provides the following types of ability templates:

    Note: In the description below, a Page, Service, or Data ability indicates an ability using the respective template, whereas the ability alone indicates an ability using any type of templates.

    • Page: An ability that displays a UI. The UI is presented through AbilitySlice. You must override the onStart(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) method and use the setMainRoute(java.lang.String) and addActionRoute(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) methods to configure the entry of a Page ability.
    • Service: An ability that runs in the background and has no UI. It is used to develop services that always run in the background or are connected to other abilities. When a Service ability is connected to others, a remote object is returned, and you can use the remote object to call the functionalities provided by the Service ability.
    • Data: An ability that is used to operate data and has no UI. It provides methods for inserting, deleting, updating, and querying data, and opening files. You must implement these methods.

    Ability Profile

    Each application has a configuration file: config.json. This file is stored in the root directory of Java code.

     ├── entry
 │   ├── libs
 │   ├── src
 │   │   ├── main
 │   │   │   ├── java
 │   │   │   │   └── com
 │   │   │   │       └── example
 │   │   │   │           └── myapplication
 │   │   │   │               ├── slice
 │   │   │   │               │   └── PageAbilitySlice.java
 │   │   │   │               └── PageAbility.java
 │   │   │   ├── resources
 │   │   │   │     ├── base
 │   │   │   │     │   ├── element
 │   │   │   │     │   │   └── string.json
 │   │   │   │     │   └── media
 │   │   │   │     │       └── icon.png
 │   │   │   │     └── rawfile
 │   │   │   └── config.json

    Description of the file structure of an application is as follows:

    entry stores the code, resource files, and configuration file of the application. The folder name is editable.

    entry/libs stores third-party library files. This directory is automatically generated by the IDE upon project creation.

    entry/src/main/java is used for code development. You can change file names in this directory as required. This directory is automatically generated by the IDE upon project creation.

    entry/src/main/resources/base/media stores PNG and JPG image files for your application. This directory is automatically generated by the IDE upon project creation.

    entry/src/main/resources/base/element stores resource files used for reading text resources. This directory is automatically generated by the IDE upon project creation.

    The entry/src/main/config.json file is located in the main root directory. This file contains configuration information about the application. The system runs the application and displays contents on the UI based on the content of this file. This file is automatically generated by the IDE upon project creation.

    To develop a new ability, you must register the ability in the config.json file. Example code:

     {
     "module":{
         ...
         "abilities":[
           {
               ...
               "description": "Main ability of hiworld",
               "name": ".MainAbility",
               "label": "main ability",
               "icon": "main-ability.png",
               "type": "page",
               "visible": true,
               "orientation": "unspecified",
               "launch-mode": "standard",
               ...
           }
         ]
         ...
     }
 }

    Note: All abilities of an application must be registered in this file and attached to the abilities tag.

    • The type tag indicates the type of templates used by an ability, and its value page, service, or provider indicates the Page, Service, or Data template, respectively. The type tag must be specified.
    • The name tag indicates the name of an ability and must be specified.
    • You can retain the default values for other tags.

    Ability Lifecycle

    As the fundamental unit of an application, an ability has the following four lifecycle states:

    • INITIAL: The ability is loaded to the memory but is not running. It is the initial state of all abilities.
    • INACTIVE: The ability has been loaded and executed but is not interactive. Generally, it is an intermediate state before the ability changes to ACTIVE or BACKGROUND. In this state, the UI may be visible but cannot receive input events.
    • ACTIVE: The ability is visible and interactive. It is considered that the ability has focus.
    • BACKGROUND: The ability is invisible. If system memory becomes insufficient, abilities in this state are destroyed first.

    The figure below shows a complete ability lifecycle. A specific callback is executed for each state transition. You can override the callback methods.

    Note: All Page abilities must implement onStart(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) to set their UIs. To override a lifecycle callback method, you must first call the callback method corresponding to the parent class, for example, super.onStart(). The state transition is implemented on the main thread. Therefore, you are advised to execute short logic in the lifecycle callback to prevent the main thread of the ability from being blocked.

    The following are all lifecycle callback methods of the ability:

     public class MainAbility extends Ability {
      protected void onStart(Intent intent);

      protected void onActive();

      protected void onInactive();

      protected void onForeground(Intent intent);

      protected void onBackground();

      protected void onStop();
  }

    For details on lifecycle callback, see AbilitySlice.

    Starting Abilities

    The startAbility(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) method is used to start a new ability, which is placed at the top of the ability stack. It uses the parameter Intent to describe the ability. The code below shows how to start an ability:

    
         Button button = new Button(this);
         button.setClickedListener(listener -> {
             Operation operation = new Intent.OperationBuilder()
                     .withDeviceId("")
                     .withBundleName("com.huawei.hiworld")
                     .withAbilityName("com.huawei.hiworld.MainAbility")
                     .build();

             Intent intent = new Intent();
             intent.setOperation(operation);
             intent.setParam("age", 10);

             startAbility(intent);
         });

    Connecting Abilities

    The connectAbility(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent,ohos.aafwk.ability.IAbilityConnection) method is used to connect to a Service ability. It has two parameters: Intent and IAbilityConnection. Intent provides information about the target Service ability to connect, and IAbilityConnection is a callback object used to notify you of the connection result (success or failure).

    In contrast to connectAbility(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent,ohos.aafwk.ability.IAbilityConnection), the disconnectAbility(ohos.aafwk.ability.IAbilityConnection) method is used to disconnect from a connected Service ability.

    For Service abilities, you can override the onConnect(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) method to provide a RemoteObject for calling. By default, null is returned.

         protected IRemoteObject onConnect(Intent intent) {
         return null;
     }
    Since:
    1

      • postTask

        public void postTask​(Runnable task,
                     long delayTime)
        Posts a scheduled Runnable task to a new non-UI thread.

        The task posted via this method will be executed in a new thread, which allows you to perform certain time-consuming operations. To use this method, you must also override the supportHighPerformanceUI() method. Additionally, the usage of this method must comply with the following constraints:

        1. This method can only be used to initialize the component tree in parallel mode.
        2. The task can only be processed during system cold start.
        3. If the parallel loading mechanism is used, the component tree-related operations to be performed in onActive() and onStop() of the ability slice must also be added to the parallel thread.
        4. You must run setUIContent(ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer) to unlock the UI thread and wait until the component tree is ready.
        5. Other time-consuming operations, such as I/O and network processing, cannot be added to the parallel task queue.
        Parameters:
        task - Indicates the Runnable task to post.
        delayTime - Indicates the number of milliseconds after which the task will be executed.
        Since:
        4

      • supportHighPerformanceUI

        public boolean supportHighPerformanceUI​()
        Checks whether this ability supports high-performance UI rendering. You should override this method and make it return true if you want your ability to support high-performance UI rendering.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this ability supports high-performance UI rendering; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • getLayoutParams

        public WindowManager.LayoutConfig getLayoutParams​()
        Obtains window layout parameters of an ability. Layout parameters must be set for windows of all abilities. These parameters are provided for the parent window to specify how to lay out the windows of the current ability.

        You can use layout parameters to control the window attributes of an ability, such as the position, length, and width.

        Returns:
        Returns window layout parameters of the ability; returns null if no layout parameter is set.

        You can use layout parameters to control the window attributes of an ability, such as the position, length, and width.

      • onKeyDown

        public boolean onKeyDown​(int keyCode,
                         KeyEvent keyEvent)
        Called when a key is pressed. When any component in the Ability gains focus, the key-down event for the component will be handled first. This callback will not be invoked if the callback triggered for the key-down event of the component returns true. The default implementation of this callback does nothing and returns false.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Indicates the code of the key pressed.
        keyEvent - Indicates the key-down event.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this event is handled and will not be passed further; returns false if this event is not handled and should be passed to other handlers.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        onKeyUp(int, ohos.multimodalinput.event.KeyEvent)

      • onKeyUp

This callback will not be invoked if the callback triggered for the key-up event of the component returns true. The default implementation of this callback does nothing and returns false.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Indicates the code of the key released.
        keyEvent - Indicates the key-up event.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this event is handled and will not be passed further; returns false if this event is not handled and should be passed to other handlers.

      • connectAbility

        public boolean connectAbility​(Intent intent,
                              IAbilityConnection conn)
        Connects an ability to a Service ability.

        This method can be called by a Page or Service ability, but the destination of the connection must be a Service ability. You must implement the IAbilityConnection interface to obtain the proxy of the target Service ability when the Service ability is connected.

        The calling Context must have been started and have not been destroyed. Otherwise, this method returns false. For example, when an AbilityForm supplier calls this method in a callback triggered upon a component click or touch event, false may be returned because the supplier may not be started.

        Specified by:
        connectAbility in interface Context
        Overrides:
        connectAbility in class AbilityContext
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the Service ability to connect.
        conn - Indicates the callback object when the Service ability is connected.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the connection is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the ability is not initialized.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is null.
        See Also:
        Context.connectAbility(Intent, IAbilityConnection)

      • disconnectAbility

        public void disconnectAbility​(IAbilityConnection conn)
        Disconnects an ability from a Service ability, in contrast to connectAbility(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent,ohos.aafwk.ability.IAbilityConnection).
        Specified by:
        disconnectAbility in interface Context
        Overrides:
        disconnectAbility in class AbilityContext
        Parameters:
        conn - Indicates the callback object when the Service ability is connected.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the ability is not initialized.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is null.
        See Also:
        Context.disconnectAbility(IAbilityConnection)

      • executeBatch

        public DataAbilityResult[] executeBatch​(ArrayList<DataAbilityOperation> operations)
                                 throws OperationExecuteException
        Performs batch operations on the database. This method should be implemented by a Data ability.

        The batch operations to be executed on the database are encapsulated as DataAbilityOperation objects. Each object corresponds to an operation, for example, inserting or deleting. The call result of each operation is saved to and returned by the data array of the DataAbilityResult type.

        Parameters:
        operations - Indicates the data operation list, which can contain multiple operations on the database.
        Returns:
        Returns the result of each operation, in array.
        Throws:
        OperationExecuteException - Throws this exception if the batch operation fails.

      • openFile

        public FileDescriptor openFile​(Uri uri,
                               String mode)
                        throws FileNotFoundException
        Opens a file. This method should be implemented by a Data ability.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the file to open.
        mode - Indicates the open mode, which can be "r" for read-only access, "w" for write-only access (erasing whatever data is currently in the file), "wt" for write access that truncates any existing file, "wa" for write-only access to append to any existing data, "rw" for read and write access on any existing data, or "rwt" for read and write access that truncates any existing file.
        Returns:
        Returns the FileDescriptor object of the file descriptor.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - Throws this exception if the file does not exist.

      • openRawFile

        public RawFileDescriptor openRawFile​(Uri uri,
                                     String mode)
                              throws FileNotFoundException
        Opens a raw file. This method should be implemented by a Data ability.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the raw file to open.
        mode - Indicates the open mode, which can be "r" for read-only access, "w" for write-only access (erasing whatever data is currently in the file), "wt" for write access that truncates any existing file, "wa" for write-only access to append to any existing data, "rw" for read and write access on any existing data, or "rwt" for read and write access that truncates any existing file.
        Returns:
        Returns the RawFileDescriptor object containing file descriptor.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - Throws this exception if the raw file does not exist.

      • createPipeFile

        public <T> FileDescriptor createPipeFile​(Uri uri,
                                         String mimeType,
                                         PacMap pacMap,
                                         T args,
                                         PipeFileWriter<T> pipeFileWriter)
                                  throws FileNotFoundException,
                                         IllegalStateException
        Creates a data pipe, calls a background thread to write the data pointed to by the specified Uri into the pipe, and returns the FileDescriptor object used for data reading.

        PipeFileWriter#write(FileDescriptor, Uri, String, PacMap, T)} must have been implemented for writing data to a pipe. You should disable the FileDescriptor object returned by this method after you finish using it.

        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the source Uri object whose data will be written.
        mimeType - Indicates the MIME type of the data to write.
        pacMap - Indicates the PacMap object to be passed in this call. This parameter can be null.
        args - Indicates the custom parameters that specify the data shared to the client. The type of this parameter is the same as the generic type in PipeFileWriter}.
        pipeFileWriter - Indicates the instance of a class that implements PipeFileWriter#write(FileDescriptor, Uri, String, PacMap, T)} for pipe data writing.
        Returns:
        Returns a FileDescriptor object for pipe data reading.
        Throws:
        OsHelperErrnoException - Throws this exception if the data pipe fails to be created.
        FileNotFoundException
        IllegalStateException
        Since:
        4

      • getFileTypes

        public String[] getFileTypes​(Uri uri,
                             String mimeTypeFilter)
        Obtains the MIME type of files. This method should be implemented by a Data ability.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the files to obtain.
        mimeTypeFilter - Indicates the MIME type of the files to obtain. This parameter cannot be set to null.

        1. "*/*": Obtains all types supported by a Data ability.

        2. "image/*": Obtains files whose main type is image of any subtype.

        3. "*/jpg": Obtains files whose subtype is JPG of any main type.

        Returns:
        Returns the MIME type of the matched files; returns null if there is no type that matches the Data ability.

        This method indicates the end of the ability lifecycle. It can be executed after the ability calls the terminateAbility() method or the last ability slice of the ability calls the AbilitySlice#terminate() method. Generally, this method is used to clear resources.

        The ability in the ACTIVE state is in the foreground and is interactive.

        Since:

      • onInactive

        protected void onInactive​()
        Called back when an ability enters the INACTIVE state (an ability in this state is not interactive and may change to the BACKGROUND or ACTIVE state).

        INACTIVE is an intermediate state and does not last for a long period of time. Frequent switching between ACTIVE and INACTIVE is possible. Therefore, you can use this method to perform certain simple operations, for example, committing any changes.

      • onForeground

        protected void onForeground​(Intent intent)
        Called back when the state of an ability changes from BACKGROUND to INACTIVE.

        This is an intermediate state callback method. Generally, the system calls this method to refresh data status and then calls back the onActive() method.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates information carried when the ability returns to the INACTIVE state.

      • onBackground

        protected void onBackground​()
        Called back when an ability enters the BACKGROUND state.

        A Page ability in the BACKGROUND state is invisible. You are advised to suspend threads related to the ability and clear some resources to free up system memory.

        @Deprecated

                         boolean restart)
        Deprecated. 
        Called back when a Service ability is started.

        This method can be called only by Service abilities. You can use the startAbility(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) method to start a Service ability. Then the system calls back the current method to use the transferred intent parameter to execute its own logic.

        restart - Indicates the startup mode. The value true indicates that the Service ability is restarted after being destroyed, and the value false indicates a normal startup.

      • onCommand

        protected void onCommand​(Intent intent,
                         boolean restart,
                         int startId)
        Called back when Service is started.

        This method can be called only by Service. You can use the startAbility(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) method to start Service. Then the system calls back the current method to use the transferred intent parameter to execute its own logic.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the intent of Service to start.
        restart - Indicates the startup mode. The value true indicates that Service is restarted after being destroyed, and the value false indicates a normal startup.
        startId - Indicates the number of times the Service ability has been started. The startId is incremented by 1 every time the ability is started. For example, if the ability has been started for six times, the value of startId is 6.
        Since:

      • onOrientationChanged

        protected void onOrientationChanged​(AbilityInfo.DisplayOrientation displayOrientation)
        Called back when the display orientation of a screen changes.

        You can override this method to implement your logic when the display orientation changes. By default, no operation is performed when the display orientation changes.

        Parameters:
        displayOrientation - Indicates the new display orientation. The following values are supported: AbilityInfo.DisplayOrientation#LANDSCAPE, AbilityInfo.DisplayOrientation#PORTRAIT, AbilityInfo.DisplayOrientation#FOLLOWRECENT, and AbilityInfo.DisplayOrientation#UNSPECIFIED.

      • onMemoryLevel

        public void onMemoryLevel​(int level)
        Called when the system has determined to trim the memory, for example, when the ability is running in the background and there is no enough memory for running as many background processes as possible.
        Parameters:
        level - Indicates the memory trim level, which shows the current memory usage status. The values and their respective meanings are as follows:
        • 5: The application is running properly and will not be killed, but the device is running slightly low on memory. The system may start to kill processes based on the Least Recently Used (LRU) list.
        • 10: The application is running properly and will not be killed, but the device is running extremely low on memory. Your application should release some unnecessary resources to improve system performance, which accordingly improves the application performance.
        • 15: The application is running properly, but the system has killed most of the cached processes based on the LRU list. In this case, your application should release as many unnecessary resources as possible. Otherwise, the system may continue to kill all the cached processes and start to kill some processes that should be kept running, for example, services running in the background.
        • 20: The application UI is hidden, for example, because the user touched the Home key on the device. Your application should releases resources allocated for UI display to free up memory.
        • 40: The device is running low on memory and your application is around the top of the LRU list. The system is not likely to kill your application. To keep your application processes in the cache for a longer time, your application should increase available system memory by releasing some resources that can be easily restored. In this way, your application is able to smoothly return to the foreground, instead of being restarted.
        • 60: The device is running extremely low on memory and your application is around the middle of the LRU list. Your application may be killed later if no more memory is freed up.
        • 80: The device is running extremely low on memory and your application is at the end of the LRU list. The system is most likely to kill your application first. In this case, your application should release all resources that can be released.

      • onReconnect

        public void onReconnect​(Intent intent)
        Called when a new client attempts to connect to a Service ability after all previous client connections to it are disconnected.

        The Service ability must have been started but not been destroyed, that is, startAbility(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) has been called but stopAbility(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) has not.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the intent of the Service ability being connected.
        Since:
        3

      • onMissionDeleted

        public void onMissionDeleted​(Intent intent)

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the original Intent used for starting the deleted mission.
        Since:
        4

      • onAbilityResult

        protected void onAbilityResult​(int requestCode,
                               int resultCode,
                               Intent resultData)
        Called when startAbilityForResult(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent,int) is called to start an ability and the result is returned.

        This method is called only on Page abilities. You can start a new ability to perform some calculations and use setResult(int,ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) to return the calculation result. Then the system calls back the current method to use the returned data to execute its own logic.

        Parameters:
        requestCode - Indicates the request code returned after the ability is started. You can define the request code to identify the results returned by abilities. The value ranges from 0 to 65535.
        resultCode - Indicates the result code returned after the ability is started. You can define the result code to identify an error.
        resultData - Indicates the data returned after the ability is started. You can define the data returned. The value can be null.

      • onCreateForm

        protected ProviderFormInfo onCreateForm​(Intent intent)
        Called to return a ProviderFormInfo object.

        You must override this method if your ability will serve as a form provider to provide a form for clients. The default implementation returns null.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the detailed information for creating a ProviderFormInfo. The Intent object must include the form ID, form name, and grid style of the form, which can be obtained from AbilitySlice#PARAM_FORM_IDENTITY_KEY, AbilitySlice#PARAM_FORM_NAME_KEY, and AbilitySlice#PARAM_FORM_DIMENSION_KEY, respectively. Such form information must be managed as persistent data for further form acquisition, update, and deletion.
        Returns:
        Returns the created ProviderFormInfo object.

      • onTriggerFormEvent

        @Deprecated
protected void onTriggerFormEvent​(int formId,
                                  String message)
        Deprecated. Use onTriggerFormEvent(long,java.lang.String) instead.
        Called when a specified message event defined by the form provider is triggered. This method is valid only for JS forms.

        You must override this method to define the work to do after the message event is triggered if a message event is configured. You can define a message event for a component on a JS form. When the user touches the particular component on the form, your application, as the form provider, will be notified and receive the value of the params field contained in the event.

        Parameters:

      • onTriggerFormEvent

        protected void onTriggerFormEvent​(long formId,
                                  String message)
        Called when a specified message event defined by the form provider is triggered. This method is valid only for JS forms.

        You must override this method to define the work to do after the message event is triggered if a message event is configured. You can define a message event for a component on a JS form. When the user touches the particular component on the form, your application, as the form provider, will be notified and receive the value of the params field contained in the event.

        Parameters:
        formId - Indicates the ID of the form on which the message event is triggered, which is provided by the client to the form provider.
        message - Indicates the value of the params field of the message event. This parameter is used to identify the specific component on which the event is triggered.
        Since:
        5

      • updateForm

        @Deprecated
public boolean updateForm​(int formId,
                          ComponentProvider component)
                   throws FormException
        Deprecated. Use updateForm(long,ohos.agp.components.ComponentProvider) instead.
        Updates the content of a specified Java form.

        This method is called by a form provider to update Java form data as needed.

        Parameters:
        formId - Indicates the ID of the Java form to update.
        component - Indicates the ComponentProvider object used to update the Java form displayed on the client.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the update is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        FormException - Throws this exception if the form fails to be obtained due to any of the following reasons:
        • The passed formID or formBindingData is invalid. The value of formID must be larger than 0, and formBindingData must not be null.
        • An error occurred when connecting to the Form Manager Service.
        • The specified form ID does not exist.
        • The form has been obtained by another application and cannot be updated by the current application.
        • The form is being restored.
        Since:
        5

      • onSaveAbilityState

        public void onSaveAbilityState​(PacMap outState)
        Saves temporary data and states of this ability. This method should be implemented by a Page ability.

        This method is called when the system determines that the ability may be destroyed in an unexpected situation, for example, when the screen orientation changes or the user touches the Home key. Generally, this method is used only to save temporary states.

        Parameters:
        outState - Indicates the PacMap object used for storing user data and states. This parameter cannot be null.

      • onStoreDataWhenConfigChange

        public Object onStoreDataWhenConfigChange​()
        Called to save the data to be destroyed when the system configuration is changed. This method can return any required object, including the ability instance itself. You can call AbilityContext.getLastStoredDataWhenConfigChanged() to obtain the saved data in a new ability instance.
        Returns:
        Returns an object of the saved data.
        Since:
        4

        public Uri onSetCaller​()
        Called to set caller information for the application. The default implementation returns null.
        Returns:
        Returns the caller information.
        Since:

      • onRestoreAbilityState

        public void onRestoreAbilityState​(PacMap inState)
        Restores data and states of an ability when it is restored by the system. This method should be implemented by a Page ability.

        This method is called if an ability was destroyed at a certain time due to resource reclaim or was unexpectedly destroyed and the onSaveAbilityState(ohos.utils.PacMap) method was called to save its user data and states. Generally, this method is called after the onStart(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) method.

        Parameters:
        inState - Indicates the PacMap object used for storing data and states. This parameter can not be null.

      • onRequestPermissionsFromUserResult

        public void onRequestPermissionsFromUserResult​(int requestCode,
                                               String[] permissions,
                                               int[] grantResults)
        Called back after permissions are requested by using AbilityContext.requestPermissionsFromUser(java.lang.String[],int).
        Parameters:
        requestCode - Indicates the request code passed to this method from AbilityContext.requestPermissionsFromUser(java.lang.String[],int).
        permissions - Indicates the list of permissions requested by using AbilityContext.requestPermissionsFromUser(java.lang.String[],int). This parameter cannot be null.
        grantResults - Indicates the granting results of the corresponding permissions requested using AbilityContext.requestPermissionsFromUser(java.lang.String[],int). The value 0 indicates that a permission is granted, and the value -1 indicates not.

      • onEventDispatch

        public void onEventDispatch​()
        Called every time a key, touch, or trackball event is dispatched to this ability. You can override this callback method if you want to know that the user has interacted with the device in a certain way while this ability is running. This method, together with onLeaveForeground(), is designed to help abilities intelligently manage status bar notifications. Specifically, they help abilities determine when to cancel a notification.
        Since:
        3

      • startAbility

        public final void startAbility​(Intent intent)
                        throws IllegalArgumentException,
                               IllegalStateException
        Starts a new ability.

        A Page or Service ability uses this method to start a specific ability. The system locates the target ability from installed abilities based on the value of the intent parameter and then starts it. You can specify the ability to start using the intent parameter.

        You can start a new Service ability even if the application hosting the ability is not started by adding a flag of Intent#FLAG_START_FOREGROUND_ABILITY.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the ability to start.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is null.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the ability is not initialized.

      • onTopActiveAbilityChanged

        public void onTopActiveAbilityChanged​(boolean topActive)
        Called when this ability is moved to or removed from the top of the stack.
        Parameters:
        topActive - Specifies whether this ability is moved to or removed from the top of the stack. The value true indicates that it is moved to the top, and false indicates that it is removed from the top of the stack.
        Since:
        4

      • startAbility

        public final void startAbility​(Intent intent,
                               AbilityStartSetting abilityStartSetting)
                        throws IllegalArgumentException,
                               IllegalStateException
        Starts a new ability with specific start settings.

        A Page or Service ability uses this method to start a specific ability. The system locates the target ability from installed abilities based on the value of the intent parameter and then starts it. You can specify the ability to start using the intent parameter.

        You can start a new Service ability even if the application hosting the ability is not started by adding a flag of Intent#FLAG_START_FOREGROUND_ABILITY.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the ability to start.
        abilityStartSetting - Indicates the setting ability used to start.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is null.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the ability is not initialized.
        Since:
        4

      • startAbilityForResult

        public final void startAbilityForResult​(Intent intent,
                                        int requestCode,
                                        AbilityStartSetting abilityStartSetting)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                        IllegalStateException
        Starts an ability with specific start settings and returns the execution result when the ability is destroyed.

        When the ability is destroyed, onAbilityResult(int,int,ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) is called and the returned requestCode is transferred to the current method. The given requestCode is customized and cannot be a negative number.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the ability to start.
        requestCode - Indicates the request code returned after the ability is started. You can define the request code to identify the results returned by abilities. The value ranges from 0 to 65535.
        abilityStartSetting - Indicates the setting ability used to start.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the ability is not initialized.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        startAbility(Intent), onAbilityResult(int, int, Intent), setResult(int, Intent)

      • startAbilityForResult

        public final void startAbilityForResult​(Intent intent,
                                        int requestCode)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                        IllegalStateException
        Starts an ability and returns the execution result when the ability is destroyed.

        When the ability is destroyed, onAbilityResult(int,int,ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) is called and the returned requestCode is transferred to the current method. The given requestCode is customized and cannot be a negative number.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the ability to start.
        requestCode - Indicates the request code returned after the ability is started. You can define the request code to identify the results returned by abilities. The value ranges from 0 to 65535.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the ability is not initialized.
        See Also:
        startAbility(Intent), onAbilityResult(int, int, Intent), setResult(int, Intent)

      • setResult

        public final void setResult​(int resultCode,
                            Intent resultData)
        Sets the result code and data to be returned by this Page ability to the caller.

        When a Page ability is destroyed, the caller overrides the AbilitySlice#onAbilityResult(int, int, Intent) method to receive the result set in the current method. This method can be called only after the ability has been initialized.

        Parameters:
        resultCode - Indicates the result code returned after the ability is destroyed. You can define the result code to identify an error.
        resultData - Indicates the data returned after the ability is destroyed. You can define the data returned. This parameter can be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if this ability is not a Page ability or the ability is not initialized.

      • terminateAbility

        public final void terminateAbility​()
        Destroys this Page or Service ability.

        After a Page or Service ability performs all operations, it can use this method to destroy itself to free up memory. This method can be called only after the ability is initialized.

        Specified by:
        terminateAbility in interface Context
        Overrides:
        terminateAbility in class AbilityContext
        See Also:
        Context.terminateAbility()

        Specified by:

        Overrides:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setMainRoute

        public final void setMainRoute​(String entry)
                        throws IllegalStateException
        Sets the main route of this ability.

        You can call this method to set the default route of the ability, that is, the AbilitySlice to present. This method can be used only for Page abilities.

        Note: If you do not set a default route in onStart(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent), the startup will fail.

        Parameters:
        entry - Indicates the main entry, which is the fully qualified name of your AbilitySlice class.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if this ability is not a Page ability or is not initialized.

        entry - Indicates the entry, which is the fully qualified name of your AbilitySlice class.

      • keepBackgroundRunning

        public final void keepBackgroundRunning​(int id,
                                        NotificationRequest notificationRequest)
        Keeps this Service ability in the background and displays a notification bar.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.KEEP_BACKGROUND_RUNNING permission from the system. The ohos.permission.KEEP_BACKGROUND_RUNNING permission is of the normal level.

        This method can be called only by Service abilities after the onStart(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) method is called.

        Parameters:
        id - Identifies the notification bar information.
        notificationRequest - Indicates the NotificationRequest instance containing information for displaying a notification bar.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if this ability is not a Service ability or is not initialized.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception in the passed NotificationRequest instance is null.
        ProfileMissingConfigException - Throws this exception if param backgroundModes is not set in profile.

      • cancelBackgroundRunning

        public final void cancelBackgroundRunning​()
                                   throws IllegalStateException
        Cancels background running of this ability to free up system memory.

        This method can be called only by Service abilities when the onStop() method is called.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if this ability is not a Service ability or is not initialized.

      • continueAbility

        public final void continueAbility​()
                           throws IllegalStateException,
                                  UnsupportedOperationException
        Migrates this ability to another device on the same distributed network.

        If there are multiple candidate devices, a pop-up will be displayed for users to choose the desired one.

        The ability to migrate and its ability slices must implement the IAbilityContinuation interface. Otherwise, an exception is thrown, indicating that the ability does not support migration.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if this ability is not initialized or is in a state where this operation is not allowed, for example, it is being migrated.
        UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if this ability does not implement the IAbilityContinuation interface.

      • continueAbility

        public final void continueAbility​(String deviceId)
                           throws IllegalStateException,
                                  UnsupportedOperationException
        Migrates this ability to the given device on the same distributed network.

        The ability to migrate and its ability slices must implement the IAbilityContinuation interface. Otherwise, an exception is thrown, indicating that the ability does not support migration.

        Parameters:
        deviceId - Indicates the ID of the target device where this ability will be migrated to. If this parameter is null, this method has the same effect as continueAbility().
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if this ability is not initialized or is in a state where this operation is not allowed, for example, it is being migrated.
        UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if this ability does not implement the IAbilityContinuation interface.
        Since:
        3

      • continueAbilityReversibly

        public final void continueAbilityReversibly​()
                                     throws IllegalStateException,
                                            UnsupportedOperationException
        Migrates this ability to another device on the same distributed network in a reversible way that allows this ability to be migrated back to the local device through reverseContinueAbility().

        If there are multiple candidate devices, a pop-up will be displayed for users to choose the desired one.

        The ability to migrate and its ability slices must implement the IAbilityContinuation interface. Otherwise, an exception is thrown, indicating that the ability does not support migration.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if this ability is not initialized or is in a state where this operation is not allowed, for example, it is being migrated.
        UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if this ability does not implement the IAbilityContinuation interface.
        Since:
        3

      • continueAbilityReversibly

        public final void continueAbilityReversibly​(String deviceId)
                                     throws IllegalStateException,
                                            UnsupportedOperationException
        Migrates this ability to the given device on the same distributed network in a reversible way that allows this ability to be migrated back to the local device through reverseContinueAbility().

        The ability to migrate and its ability slices must implement the IAbilityContinuation interface. Otherwise, an exception is thrown, indicating that the ability does not support migration.

        Parameters:
        deviceId - Indicates the ID of the target device where this ability will be migrated to. If this parameter is null, this method has the same effect as continueAbilityReversibly().
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if this ability is not initialized or is in a state where this operation is not allowed, for example, it is being migrated.
        UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if this ability does not implement the IAbilityContinuation interface.
        Since:
        3

                                     throws IllegalStateException,
                                            UnsupportedOperationException
        Migrates this ability from another device on the same distributed network back to the local device.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the migration request is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if this ability was not involved in a reversible migration process, or if it is in a state where this operation is not allowed, for example, it is being migrated back.

                                   throws IllegalStateException
        Sets the transition animation among AbilitySlice instances of the current ability.

        You can use the AbilitySliceAnimator class to define animation properties. Currently, only translation is supported. Rotation, gradient, and scale operations will be supported later. The properties can be set by calling the onStart(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) method of the ability.

        abilitySliceAnimator - Indicates the animation properties, such as translate, rotate, or alpha. If this parameter is null, the transition animation is disabled.

      • onWindowFocusChanged

        public void onWindowFocusChanged​(boolean hasFocus)
        Called when this ability gains or loses window focus.

        The focus state refers to the global state, which is independent of the ability lifecycle states. Although the lifecycle state change of an ability may lead to a focus change (for example, onStop() may cause the ability to lose window focus), there is no particular sequence between this callback and other lifecycle callbacks such as onBackground().

        Generally, the ability in the foreground will have window focus. The ability will lose focus when another dialog box or pop-up window is displayed. The ability will also lose focus when a system-level window (such as the status bar or a system alarm) is displayed.

        Parameters:
        hasFocus - Specifies whether this ability has focus.
        Since:
        3

      • setSwipeToDismiss

        public boolean setSwipeToDismiss​(boolean isEnabled)
        Sets whether a window and its ability finishes when swiped away.
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - Specifies whether a window should dismiss when swiped away.
        Returns:
        Returns true if set successfully; returns false otherwise.

      • normalizeUri

        public Uri normalizeUri​(Uri uri)
        Converts the given uri that refer to the Data ability into a normalized URI. A normalized URI can be used across devices, persisted, backed up, and restored. It can refer to the same item in the Data ability even if the context has changed.

        If you implement URI normalization for a Data ability, you must also implement denormalizeUri(ohos.utils.net.Uri) to enable URI denormalization. After this feature is enabled, URIs passed to any method that is called on the Data ability must require normalization verification and denormalization.

        The default implementation of this method returns null, indicating that this Data ability does not support URI normalization.

        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the Uri object to normalize.
        Returns:
        Returns the normalized Uri object if the Data ability supports URI normalization; returns null otherwise.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        denormalizeUri(ohos.utils.net.Uri)

      • denormalizeUri

        public Uri denormalizeUri​(Uri uri)
        Converts the given normalized uri generated by normalizeUri(ohos.utils.net.Uri) into a denormalized one. The default implementation of this method returns the original URI passed to it.
        Parameters:
        uri - uri Indicates the Uri object to denormalize.
        Returns:
        Returns the denormalized Uri object if the denormalization is successful; returns the original Uri passed to this method if there is nothing to do; returns null if the data identified by the original Uri cannot be found in the current environment.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        normalizeUri(ohos.utils.net.Uri)

      • parseValuesBucketReference

        public ValuesBucket parseValuesBucketReference​(DataAbilityResult[] refResults,
                                               DataAbilityOperation operation,
                                               int numRefs)
                                        throws OperationExecuteException
        Obtains the ValuesBucket object by parsing the database operation results based on the specified operation.
        Parameters:
        refResults - Indicates the result set of database operations. This parameter cannot be null.
        operation - Indicates the database operation. This parameter cannot be null.
        numRefs - Indicates the index of a valid database operation specified by operation. The index is used to locate a particular database operation result in refResults.
        Returns:
        Returns the ValuesBucket object parsed from the specified database operation result.
        Throws:
        OperationExecuteException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        4

      • parsePredictionArgsReference

        public DataAbilityPredicates parsePredictionArgsReference​(DataAbilityResult[] refResults,
                                                          DataAbilityOperation operation,
                                                          int numRef)
                                                   throws OperationExecuteException
        Obtains the DataAbilityPredicates object by parsing the database operation results based on the specified operation.
        Parameters:
        refResults - Indicates the result set of database operations. This parameter cannot be null.
        operation - Indicates the database operation. This parameter cannot be null.
        numRef - Indicates the index of a valid database operation specified by operation. The index is used to locate a particular database operation result in refResults.
        Returns:
        Returns the DataAbilityPredicates object parsed from the specified database operation result.
        Throws:
        OperationExecuteException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        4
